full_text:
The first woman to reach the summit of #K2 and the first female European to climb #MtEverest. The conqueror of 8 out of 14 "eight-thousanders".

Meet Wanda #Rutkiewicz, a legend of world mountaineering! 💪👩

#OutstandingPLWomen 🇵🇱 https://t.co/pdIvoUJXeZ

Fingers crossed for our #Eurovision2024 contestant Luna🌙 🇵🇱  Vote Poland 6⃣ tonight!

🔹First Semi-Final
Tuesday 7 May, 21:00 CEST

🔹Second Semi-Final
Thursday 9 May, 21:00 CEST

🔹Grand Final
Saturday 11 May, 21:00 CEST https://t.co/EJ8OSsH32I

Every July, sailors from all over the world come to @MiastoGdynia 🇵🇱 to compete in top-level regattas during Gdynia Sailing Days 🌊. 

This year's edition is planned for June 28  – July 21: a perfect warm-up for sailors before the @Olympics! https://t.co/SzTJGbLo00

3rd May means one more holiday! 🥳

Today, we commemorate the signing of the Constitution of May 3, 1791, which was one of the first modern constitutions in the world. 🎉

The document was adopted by the 🇵🇱 Great Sejm, to reform state by ensuring more freedom and equality. https://t.co/zlVYYwXcv8

Today it is the 20th anniversary of Poland's 🇵🇱 accession to the European Union! 🎉

Becoming part of the 🇪🇺 family has opened many new doors and created new opportunities. It helped our country modernise and grow economically.

🇱🇹🇱🇻🇪🇪🇨🇿🇸🇰🇨🇾🇸🇮🇲🇹🇭🇺 are also celebrating with us! https://t.co/gVN4pHcRzM

On the #InternationalJazzDay meet the queen of jazz, Urszula Dudziak whose mesmerizing voice and daring experiments took jazz to new heights 🎷

From scat to vocal improvisation, her creativity knows no bounds! #OutstandingPLWomen https://t.co/5oO4HSa5Z3

100 years ago, the 🇵🇱 złoty (PLN) was officially introduced into circulation 🪙. 

The monetary reform implemented by the Grabski government contributed to stabilising the country's economic situation after WWI.

Do you know all the characters on 🇵🇱 banknotes? https://t.co/BzReqnyBWd

The castles and fortresses in the Kraków-Częstochowa Upland used to defend access to the trade routes of the Kingdom of Poland.

Currently, they constitute the Trail of the Eagles' Nests, recognized as one of the leading trails in the nationwide register of marked hiking routes. https://t.co/1ZHQUeG4OV

🐏 Today is the day of Saint Adalbert, the patron of shepherds. Traditionally, the "redyk" begins.

🏔️ The ceremonial leading of the 🐑 to the pastures is often accompanied by highland folk music and cheese.

❔Are you staying in 🇵🇱 - take a walk on the trail of shepherd's huts! https://t.co/RXUkCqYNsH

Janina Lewandowska was a brave 🇵🇱 WWII pilot, and the first female pilot in the Polish Air Force ✈️.

When she was 20, she became the first woman in Europe to parachute from a 5⃣0⃣0⃣0⃣ m altitude!

Janina was killed by the Soviets in the Katyń Massacre in 1940. https://t.co/EEX8dqxDA4

Green trees, blooming flowers.... but the real sign of the arrival of spring and good luck is the stork! 🌳🌼

In mid-April, thousands of storks return to Poland 🇵🇱 and make their nests, usually on high electricity poles or rooftops.

Read more➡️https://t.co/gMINQyTjRL

#bociany https://t.co/vcQcmLItHI

Ⓜ️ The Warsaw metro has a long history. The plans to build an underground railroad predate WWII!

🚇 The construction of Line 1 began #OTD in 1983, first stations opened in 1995, and now there are 2 lines and 38 stations! 

Take a look at historic 🖼️ from the construction site ⤵️ https://t.co/IDaQl5wAAo

Today, we honor the #Katyn massacre victims🕯️

The Katyń Museum in Warsaw has collected documents and personal items of the victims of the massacre committed by the Soviet regime.

In 2017, the museum was nominated for the European Union Prize for Contemporary Architecture award. https://t.co/M3CdkddShZ

"Znachor", a popular 📺 drama based on a 1937 novel, has won the hearts of Poles in the 1980s.

Last year, the 💔 story of a surgeon who lost his memory was re-told as "Forgotten Love".

If you don't know the ending of this 🌍 hit, you should definitely watch on @NetflixPL. 🍿 https://t.co/drwHzjo3LB

❔How to recognize spring in the Polish mountains ⛰️⤵️

🌸 Crocuses will help you! 
These undoubtedly beautiful flowers become even more charming when you consider that they are one of the first signs of the approaching spring. https://t.co/IRnBw2iTvu

📚 43% of Poles 🇵🇱 have read at least one book in 2023 - this is an increase of 9 percentage points ⬆️ and the best result in 🔟 years according to the National Library study!

The general interest in libraries has also increased, especially among young men aged 25–39 👫 https://t.co/n142TbfKC3

📅 Today marks the 230th anniversary of the Battle of Racławice, where Tadeusz #Kościuszko led the insurgents in the fight for independence, claiming victory over the Russian occupier.

His determination and sacrifice continue to inspire the fight for freedom and independence. https://t.co/MJ8DJpxnzq

Beware: It's time for Śmigus-Dyngus! 🪣💦

Otherwise known as Wet Monday, it is an integral part of the Easter holiday in 🇵🇱. 🐣

Read more about this interesting tradition and stay alert today! ⬇️
https://t.co/CdQ26nkVBe https://t.co/do7c69PRNW

Poles love their holiday traditions rooted in regional folklore. No matter how you celebrate #Easter, we hope you will have a chance to spend time with your loved ones, eat delicious food, and simply celebrate wellbeing. 🤗

Wesołego Alleluja! 🐣🌷 https://t.co/fR8FUB0sHW

In olden times, Easter was considered so sacred, that people would not eat food that had not been blessed with holy water - and that's how the tradition of blessing Easter baskets (święconka) was born 🧺! 

Read about the staples of Polish Easter cuisine⬇️
https://t.co/b0WVleTgdE https://t.co/Iy8JSTZgCN
